Description: Body sherd (mended from six fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: two black-figure friezes; above, deer grazing to left (top of head, back and tail missing; added red on belly and dot on flank); on the right, part of feline hind leg, to right; rosettes as filling ornament;below, separated by single band, lotus flower and bud chain with red on petals, outside leaves of lotus, and on collars; below, band and glazed lower wall.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.571.b, 1888,0601.571.c, 1888,0601.572 and 1965,0930.803.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0134) (Phase 1)
